It has been rumoured that Western art peaked during the first six seconds of this song

I’ll pretend that I’m kissing
 The lips I am missing

In this statement, it becomes unclear to the listener whether this song is actually a love letter to Jane Asher or if in fact, it is a story about each woman McCartney gets with in each city of his tours, in a snarky way he is admitting to kissing other girls

I’ll write home everyday
 And I’ll send all my loving to you

Since this song was considered Paul McCartney’s first major work he possibly wrote these lyrics with his girlfriend, famous actress Jane Asher, in mind.

“We played the Moss Empire circuit a lot, and there were always these nice big empty backstage areas… We arrived at the gig and I remember being in one of these big backstage areas and there was a piano there so I’d got my instrument. I didn’t have a guitar, it was probably with our road manager, and I remember working the tune out to it on the piano.”



While on his way to perform at the Moss Empire Circuit in Edinburgh, Scotland McCartney wrote this song, while Asher was at her family home in England on Wimpole Street.

Tomorrow I’ll miss you
 Remember I’ll always be true
Even though tomorrow he will most likely be away or on tour, his lady will stay in his mind and heart and only she.
